page.title: 09WAY OF LIFE, RANBY
page.content: In the days before the development of a modern transport system, the inhabitants of Ranby were employed for the most part in local agriculture. Its isolation was broken with the building of the Chesterfield Canal. This bisects the village and must have made a great impact. The coming of motor transport has had vital effects on the development of the village. Its situation, within easy reach of Sheffield, Worksop and Retford has made it attractive to commuters. This was enhanced when the Ranby by-pass scheme was completed in 1966. It eliminated through traffic from the village, dangerous bends, and the notorious Ranby roundabout. In 1974 further development was approved and to a certain extent Ranby has become a dormitory village.
